newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Everbright IHD soars despite denial.
newsitem.headline: China Everbright IHD soars despite denial.

text.p: Shares of red chip China Everbright-IHD Pacific Ltd soared to an all time high on Friday, despite a statement from the company saying it was not in negotiations to acquire a stake in Everbright Bank of China.

The company said it was considering a number of possible acquisitions including some investments held by China Everbright Holdings Co Ltd, one of which was a possible acquisition of equity interest in Everbright Bank of China.
"However, no negotiations whatsoever have been conducted and no binding agreement has been reached in connection with the acquisition," it said.
Shares of China Everbright IHD Pacific were trading HK$1.85, or 18.23 percent, higher at HK$12.00 in Friday afternoon trade, an all-time high for the share.
Brokers said that in addition to rumours regarding its acquisition of a stake in Everbright Bank of China, there was speculation Everbright IHD would have a new share placement.
"This company has a close connection with the Chinese government and it is said it will receive greater emphasis from the authorities," said Peter Lai, associate director at OCBC Securities.
Brokers said Everbright IHD was also rumoured to be interested in taking a stake in Theme International.
Shares in Theme were suspended in early afternoon. Prior to the suspension, the share put on HK$0.675 to HK$4.225 on relatively heavy turnover of HK$128.21 million.
Shares in China Everbright International were also trading higher. The share leaped to HK$1.96 before easing to trade HK$0.19, or 11.05 percent, higher at HK$1.92.
China Everbright Technology Ltd also jumped to HK$1.79 then eased to trade HK$0.13 higher at HK$1.74.
